name: Empanadas (Beef Turnovers)
author: Goya
summary: The perfect pastry for all meals! Empanadas, or beef turnovers, are discs of pastry packed with meat. Some turnover recipes call for all manner of fillings, but this GOYA® Empanada recipe features a delicious tomato, onion, garlic and beef mixture. You can enjoy empanadas as an appetizer, a main dish, or even after your main course. Use GOYA® Discos, or frozen pastry rounds, for a flaky beef turnover that will make your mouth water.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Goya Extra Virgin Olive Oil
½ medium yellow onion, finely chopped
6  Goya Spanish Olives Stuffed with Minced Pimientos, thinly sliced
1 packet Sazon Goya with Coriander and Annatto
Goya Ground Black Pepper, to taste
1 (14 ounce) package Goya Discos (yellow or white), thawed
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking up meat with a wooden spoon, about 10 minutes
Add onions and cook until soft, about 5 minutes more
Stir in tomato sauce, olives, Sofrito, Sazon, garlic, oregano and black pepper
Lower heat to medium-low and simmer until mixture thickens, about 15 minutes
On a lightly floured work surface, using a rolling pin, roll out discos until 1/2-inch larger in diameter
meat mixture into middle, fold in half to form a half moon; moisten edges with water and pinch to seal closed, or seal with a fork
Fill a deep saucepan with oil to a depth of 2 1/2-inches
Heat oil over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking (350 degrees F on deep-fry thermometer)
Cook Empanadas in batches until crisp and golden brown, flipping once, 4 - 6 minutes
Transfer to paper towels to drain
